title: Heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in the Northern, North-central and Eastern provinces.

title: IMF to issue official statement on third EFF review today
byline: Representatives of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) are scheduled to issue an official statement this morning (23) regarding the third review under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

title: President calls on state employees to fulfill people’s aspirations
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake stated that if the current government fails to meet the expectations set by the people in the recent mandate, it could lead to citizens losing hope in envisioning a prosperous future.

title: 6 tourists died in Laos after apparently drinking methanol
byline: Two Australian teenagers and a British woman died from suspected methanol poisoning after drinking tainted alcohol in Laos. An American man and two Danes also died, though their exact causes of death have not been released.

title: Two brothers killed as Jeep plunges into Bujgamuwa Oya
byline: Two individuals were killed in an accident when a jeep traveling from Kuliyapitiya to Hettipola veered off the road and plunged into the Bujgamuwa Oya near the Kamburapola Bridge on the Kuliyapitiya-Hettipola road this morning (23).

title: IMF reaches staff-level agreement on third review of Sri Lanka’s EFF
byline: IMF staff and the Sri Lankan authorities have reached staff-level agreement on economic policies to conclude the third review of Sri Lanka’s economic reform program supported by the IMF’s Extended Fund Facility (EFF).

title: LG Election scheduled for early next year - Vijitha Herath
byline: Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, Vijitha Herath, has announced that it has been decided to conduct the Local Government Elections at the beginning of next year.

title: KDU bus accident: Death toll rises to 3 as another student dies
byline: Another student has reportedly succumbed to injuries sustained in the fatal bus accident that occurred on November 01 in Badulla, increasing the death toll to three.

title: Heavy showers of 150 mm expected in several provinces
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showers or thundershowers will occur at times in the Northern, North-central, Eastern and Uva provinces and in Hambantota District.

title: Jonathan Majors’ ex-girlfriend drops defamation and assault lawsuit
byline: Jonathan Majors ‘ ex-girlfriend has dropped her assault and defamation lawsuit against the once-rising Hollywood star after reaching a settlement.

title: Sri Lanka’s new govt committed to stick within IMF ‘guardrails’ - Peter Breuer
byline: Sri Lanka’s new government has agreed to press ahead with a IMF bailout programme that involves tough austerity and economic reforms, the international lender announced on Saturday (Nov 23).

title: ‘Red’ warning issued as low-pressure area to intensify and move towards Sri Lanka’s Northern coast
byline: The Meteorology Department says a low-pressure area has formed over southeast Bay of Bengal and it is likely to move west northwestwards and intensify into a depression over southwest Bay of Bengal on 25 November.

title: Sri Lanka ‘should be vigilant’ about Adani power deal following US indictment, say experts
byline: Sri Lanka should be vigilant about the Adani power project in the island, experts said, after Federal prosecutors in New York indicted Group Chairman Gautam Adani and seven others on multiple counts of fraud.

title: Nearly 30 former MPs are yet to vacate their official residences
byline: It has been reported that nearly 30 former Members of Parliament (MPs) are yet to hand over their official residences.

title: President Dissanayake should fully implement vision document with India: Ranil Wickremesinghe
byline: Former Sri Lankan President Ranil Wickremesinghe said his successor Anura Kumara Dissanayake should fully implement the “vision document” adopted with India last year.
